net.sourceforge.gxl
Class GXLAttr

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--net.sourceforge.gxl.GXLElement
        |
        +--net.sourceforge.gxl.GXLAttributedElement
              |
              +--net.sourceforge.gxl.GXLAttr
public class GXLAttr
extends GXLAttributedElement

Represents the GXL attr element.

The attr element is used to provide attributes to GXLAttributedElements in a name/value fashion.

Please observe the difference between (1) GXLAttr elements that attribute GXL entities and (2) XML element attributes that is used to markup the GXL format.

Children
GXLType - see GXLType.
GXLAttr - attr elements are themselves attributed elements so as to provide for hierachical attributes.
GXLValue - each attr element MUST contain exactly one value.

Attributes
id - Optional id of this attr element.
name - Required name of this attr element. MUST be unique across the GXLAttributedElement that this attr belongs to.
kind - Optional string describing this attr element.

See Also:
GXLAttributedElement, GXLValue

Parameters:

Method Detail

setValue

public void setValue(GXLValue value)
Changes the value contained in this attr element. This method is useful when you want to change the type of value that the attribute represents, which would otherwise require creating a new attr element and inserting that instead. In the case of changing the value to the same type, the subclasses of GXLValue provides appropriate methods as well.

Parameters:
value - The new value of this attr element.
Throws:
GXLValidationException - If this action would result in an invalid GXL document.
Since:
0.91
See Also:
GXLAtomicValue.setValue(String)

getValue

public GXLValue getValue()
Returns the GXLValue of this attr element.

Returns:
The GXLValue of this attr element.

getName

public String getName()
Returns the value of the name attribute or null if the attribute isn't set. This simply calls getAttribute(GXL.NAME).

Returns:
The value of the name attribute.

GXLElement.getAttribute(String)

setName

public void setName(String name)
Sets the value of the name attribute. This simply calls setAttribute(GXL.NAME, name).

Parameters:
name - The new value.
Throws:
GXLValidationException - If this action would result in an invalid GXL document.
